item.title: wince-child

item.title: about me
item.dc:creator: Minimalio
item.content:encoded:
About me

My series explores abandoned and weathered buildings left from the city’s mid-century modernist era. I like crumbling facades and faded murals that suggest both grandeur and neglect. I like to photograph early morning mist to enhance the feeling of time standing still. Each image invites reflection on urban decay and cultural memory. It’s a visual elegy for forgotten space

email@email.com

instagram

item.title: Steel Horizons
item.dc:creator: Minimalio
item.content:encoded:
Steel Horizons

Location: Tokyo
Date: July 2022
Mood: Futuristic

Set in the high-rise business districts of Tokyo, this series emphasizes reflective surfaces and towering glass facades. Neon light trails and long exposures bring a cinematic edge to the shots. The work explores the tension between modernity and overdevelopment. Skyscrapers loom like monoliths, blurring the line between architecture and art. The atmosphere is vibrant yet unsettling.

item.title: Concrete Geometry
item.dc:creator: Minimalio
item.content:encoded:
Concrete Geometry

Location: Berlin, Germany
Date: March 2023
Mood: Minimalist

This project captures the stark lines and geometric forms of Berlin’s Brutalist architecture. Each frame isolates repetitive concrete patterns, transforming them into abstract compositions. The photographer used overcast skies to eliminate shadows and focus attention on form. Subtle tonal contrasts enhance the feeling of cold detachment. The result is a visual study in symmetry and structure.
